poem:
**Unexpected Guests**

Rhinos, rich 
on Chitwan's 
lush promise, 
amble into town, 

their heavy steps 
leaving marks—
unexpected, 
like scattered rose petals— 

on softness meant
for lighter feet.
In hospital beds
gentle voices bruise, 

asking why wild 
hearts wander, 
seeking whispers 
in the roar of streets.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sauntering on streets and grazing on lawns: what happens when rhinos move into town? “I can’t talk now, I’m in hospital,” Ram Kumar Aryal says when he picks up the phone. “Someone has been attacked by one of the rhinos.” Every few months, Aryal – who is one of the architects of Nepal’s celebrated rhino conservation programme – ends up in one of the hospitals around Chitwan national park to respond to a rhino attack.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Sauntering on streets and grazing on lawns: what happens when rhinos move into town? “I can’t talk now, I’m in hospital,” Ram Kumar Aryal says when he picks up the phone. “Someone has been attacked by one of the rhinos.” Every few months, Aryal – who is one of the architects of Nepal’s celebrated rhino conservation programme – ends up in one of the hospitals around Chitwan national park to respond to a rhino attack.
